revised_title: Effects of Stress and Magnetization on the Thermoelectric Quality of Iron: A Study of Hysteresis and its Influence on Iron Wires
tldr: This study investigates the effects of stress and magnetization on the thermoelectric quality of iron, revealing that stress directly affects the thermoelectric quality and that hysteresis is present in both magnetic and thermoelectric changes. The research also explores the influence of vibration and demagnetization on hysteresis effects and the similarities between iron and granular media properties.
